field.label: Optimize for Multiwan
field.help: Optimize setup to be used in scenarios where multiple connections to the internet are available, this feature changes the standard destination based routing into a partial source based setup. When only a single gateway is used, we advise to keep this setting disabled. You can always enable the force default and/or reply-to features manually in the advanced firewall page or change firewall rules manually.

field.label: Automatic DHCP/DNS registration
field.help: Use this option to automatically forward local dns requests for our domain (as configured in the general information domain) to DNSMasq which is used as our default dhcp service. In order for this to work, we will configure DNSMasq to listen on port 53053 and install forwards to it from Unboud (which is used as our resolver)

field.label: Optimize for IPsec
field.help: IPsec traffic processing is deferred to a separate thread by default via netisr. The system default for such processing is single-threaded by default due to protocol ordering requirements, but this can be scaled up to the amount of CPUs a machine has. This scaling can only happen for multiple flows, not single packets, therefore this option will only provide proper load distribution, not throughput performance gains for single flows.
